description: A high mountain pass on the eastern Pir Panjal Range of the Himalayas, known for its scenic beauty and adventure sports.
An ancient temple dedicated to Lord Hanuman, situated on Jakhoo Hill, the highest point in Shimla.
Often referred to as 'Mini Switzerland of India', this lake is surrounded by meadows and forests.
One of the oldest forts in India, offering panoramic views of the surrounding valley.
entry_fee: INR 150 for Indians, INR 300 for foreigners

description: A spiritual center and residence of the Dalai Lama, featuring a peaceful ambiance and Tibetan architecture.
An ancient cave temple dedicated to Hidimba Devi, surrounded by cedar forests and known for its unique pagoda-style architecture.
best_time_to_visit: May to July, September to October

description: A picturesque valley offering adventure sports like paragliding, zorbing, and skiing, surrounded by snow-capped peaks.
best_time_to_visit: December to February for snow activities; May to June for paragliding

description: Natural hot springs with separate bathing areas for men and women, believed to have healing properties.
A UNESCO World Heritage Site, home to diverse flora and fauna, offering trekking and wildlife viewing opportunities.
entry_fee: INR 100 for Indians, INR 400 for foreigners
best_time_to_visit: April to June, September to November

description: A sacred temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, known for its tall staff that attracts lightning, offering panoramic views of the Kullu Valley.
A spacious open street in the heart of Shimla, offering panoramic views of the surrounding mountains and colonial-era buildings.
best_time_to_visit: March to June, September to November

description: The highest point in Shimla, offering a panoramic view of the city and home to the ancient Jakhoo Temple.
best_time_to_visit: March to June, September to November

description: The second oldest church in North India, known for its neo-Gothic architecture and stained glass windows.
best_time_to_visit: March to June, September to November

description: A sacred site featuring a naturally formed ice Shivling during winters, accessible via a short trek or ATV ride.
